Context:
The Ontario college mentioned in the text is George Brown College. They offer two pathways to the skilled trades: one for those not ready to become apprentices through post-secondary trades-related programs, and another for those who want to start an apprenticeship with in-school educational components. Their programs aim to prepare graduates as work-place ready individuals, offering industry-standard technology and equipment in labs and studios. The college has an Entry Advising service for matching skills, background, and career goals with program options. Prospective students can attend information sessions and campus tours, and contact the college via phone or email. Their website contains information subject to change without notice. The college's partnerships with employers and government ensure industry standards and requirements are taught. The college offers a free Entry Advising service.

Key Information:
- George Brown College
- Two pathways to skilled trades: post-secondary programs, apprenticeship in-school components
- Industry-standard technology and equipment in labs and studios
- Free Entry Advising service
- Contact information: 416-415-2000 (voice), TTY: 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca
- Partnerships with employers and government for established industry standards and requirements
- Information sessions and campus tours available
- Sign up to receive college news, application deadlines, events, and tour information

No specific factual numbers or years were mentioned in the text.
